results.title: High noon in Jakarta
results.creator_credit: Christine Olsen, Curtis Levy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Olsen Levy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big picture”.
A look at the life of Abdurrahman Wahid, the first democratically elected President of Indonesia and the many challenges he faces in governing this highly fragmented society. Shows the pressure Wahid faces from the Army, which is reluctant to hand over powers it gained under the 30 years of General Soeharto’s dictatorship. Follows Wahid on a foreign trip while back in Indonesia General Wiranto, the Indonesian military leader, has been accused of human rights abuses against the East Timorese people. An interesting and insightful documentary of President Wahid, his family, his Islamic beliefs and philosophy, and his political diplomacy with foreign leaders and the international media. Includes images of some personal and upfront moments in Wahid’s daily rituals.

results.title: The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley
results.brief_description: Mystery, action and songs abound as Detectives Mary-Kate and Ashley undertake a set of daring advetures. These trenchcoat twins and their dog Clue live by their agency motto to “solve any crime by dinner time.”

results.title: Religions of the world
results.brief_description: This series sets out to examine the characteristics of the five main world religions: Islam, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity and Hinduism. Each episode looks at the history and present day practices.

results.title: Shinto
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
Shinto, the indigenous religion of Japan, is one of the world’s oldest religious traditions and currently has around sixty-two million followers. It is rooted in mythology and folk rituals that have been passed down through the generations and although it has no congressional worship, founder, or written doctrine, it has at times served to unify Japan as a nation and to mobilise the country politically. Narrated by Ben Kingsley this video describes the social codes and daily life of its followers.

results.title: Orthodox and Roman Catholicism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
Orthodox and Roman Catholicism have their roots in the first century of the Common Era and have been intrinsically tied to the development of world history. Narrated by Ben Kingsley, this video compares the differences between the two religions, describing the practices, customs and traditions.

results.title: Judaism: the religion of a people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The religious practices and laws of Judaism have been handed down intact over many milleniums. This program looks at the foundations of Jewish teaching and laws as well as giving insight into the history of the Jewish people and their struggle to keep their identity and homeland.

results.title: Islam: the faith and the people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Islam is the world’s fastest growing religion and embraced by one out of every five people on earth. The program looks at the Islamic faith in comtemporary society as well as it’s history and the Prophet Mohammed. Also featured is a discussion of art and science in the Islamic faith.

results.title: Hinduism: an ancient path in the modern world
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The program covers the characteristics and origins of Hinduism, a religion with no single founder and no defined organisation. Hinduism is an ancient path in the modern world with roots that stretch back before the dawn of recorded time. The program also looks at how the caste system operates as part of Indian society.

results.title: Christianity: the way of goodness and mercy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Christianity is a religion which has more followers than any other. Jesus Christ is the central figure of worship and his life, deeds and teachings had a profound effect on human history. Shot in various locations, the program discusses everything from the Sermon on the Mount to the Dead Sea Scrolls.

results.title: Buddhism: the middle way of compassion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Religions of the world”.
A compassionate view of life, Buddhism has had a profound influence on the philosophical and political development of the nations of Asia. People in the West are becoming increasingly attracted to Buddhism and there are over 250 million followers. This episode looks at the life of the Buddha and at different types of Buddhist beliefs.
